metadata.title: CVE-2016-3679 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
Multiple unspecified vulnerabilities in Google V8 before 4.9.385.33, asused in Google Chrome before 49.0.2623.108, allow attackers to cause adenial of service or possibly have other impact via unknown vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-3679` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

chromium-browser - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233
chromium-browser-l10n - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233
chromium-chromedriver - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233
chromium-codecs-ffmpeg-extra - 49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233
No subscription required

liboxideqt-qmlplugin - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtcore0 - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
liboxideqtquick0 - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
oxideqt-codecs-extra - 1.14.7-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libv8-3.14: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'libv8 not supported').
chromium-browser package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '49.0.2623.108-0ubuntu1.1233').
oxide-qt package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.14.7-0ubuntu1').
